intro: Bolophyta ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Bolophyta ligulata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks.
